page.title: 18EASTCOMBE 3
page.content: A famous citizen of Eastcombe, Thomas Davies was schoolmaster in the Church of England school, having begun life as a farm labourer's son, and who later became M.P. in Cirencester. A private survey was conducted in the village in 1979. It showed that 62 people in the village were either retired or unemployed. Most of the factories in the valleys employ fewer people and have changed to engineering or light industry from their earlier use as cloth mills. At one time there were a large number of children living in the village as it was used to foster Dr. Barnado's children and there was an orphanage run by nuns. Today the primary school has between fifty and sixty pupils in three classes. There are some families still living in the village who can trace their ancestors for three generations.
